summary: Most frontend requirements for a single-page promo site appear implemented (hero, about, featured grid, header with anchor navigation, external link safety/accessibility, warm theme, and SEO meta tags). However, the required generated static image assets are referenced but not present in the diff, and unnecessary Internet Identity/auth plumbing was added despite “no auth required for this landing site.”

missing_requirements.requirement: Add generated static image assets (hero/banner and a channel avatar placeholder) and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images from the backend).
missing_requirements.reason: The UI references the generated images, but the diff does not show the required image files being added under frontend/public/assets/generated.

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity authentication/provider and actor/React Query identity-based actor recreation, despite the request stating no auth is required for this landing site.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest constraints specify that auth is not required (and II only if needed). The diff adds an InternetIdentityProvider and related hooks even though the backend has no methods and the site is a static landing page.
evidence: frontend/src/main.tsx (wraps app with InternetIdentityProvider and QueryClientProvider)

hallucinated_features.description: Use of third-party icon libraries (react-icons) for social/YouTube icons instead of providing/using the requested generated social icon asset set.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly requires a generated social/icon image set (social-icons-set.dim_256x256.png). The diff shows react-icons usage and no evidence of the generated asset being added/used.
